intro: Homalium axillare subsp. axillare, commonly known as the axillary homalium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically alternate and pinnately arranged. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in inflorescences, often accompanied by specialized structures called cyathia. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
